be.ac.kuleuven.cs.ips2.project2002.logicCircuits
Class LogicCircuit

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--be.ac.kuleuven.cs.ips2.project2002.logicCircuits.LogicCircuit
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bit, LogicGate
public abstract class LogicCircuit
extends java.lang.Object

LogicCircuit instances represent electronic logic circuits. Their main property is that they have a boolen value (getValue()). When the value changes, instances of this type send ValueChangedEvents to registered ValueChangedListeners.

To make it easier to identify logic circuit instances in a user interface, all logic circuit instances have a String name getName().

2 kinds of logic circuits are discerned: autonomous logic circuits and derived logic circuits, or logic gates. Autonomous logic circuits get their boolean value from some external source. The value of gates depend on the value of other logic circuits. As a consequence, a change in the boolean value of a given logic circuit might result in a change of the boolean value of its dependent logic gates, recursively. In general, any logic circuit thus needs to notify its dependents of a change in its boolean value, so they can calculate the effect of that change on their own boolean value, and change it if necessary.

This class offers final support for the name property, the boolean value property, and administration and notification of the value changed listeners and dependents.
setValue(boolean) changes the actual value of this logic circuit instance, taking care of all necessary notifications. This method is protected, because some subtypes, more specifically gates, cannot offer this functionality publicly. Their boolean value is under their control, and should not be mutable by a user.

For demonstration purposes, instances of this type are required to notify interested DemoUpdateListeners when they start contemplating a change in the local boolean value, and when this process is completed (whether the value was actually changed or not). This class offers final support for the administration of those listeners.

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Jan Dockx

getValue

hasSameValue

public final boolean hasSameValue(LogicCircuit other)
This logic circuit has the same value as other. We explicitly do not use Object.equals(Object) for this. Instances of this class have to work with referential semantics in different places, such as collections. Logic circuits with the same boolean value are not necessarily equal.

setValue

protected final void setValue(boolean value)

Set the boolean value of this and do necessary notifications.

If value is not different from the current value of getValue(), nothing happens.

Parameters:
value - The new value of this logic circuit.
